item.title: 俄罗斯在黄金涨势中获利2160亿美元，弥补了损失的资产
item.description: 自俄罗斯对乌克兰发动战争以来，金价飙升使其意外获利，其规模堪比因普京总统入侵而被欧洲冻结的主权储备。【原文：Russia has reaped a windfall from a surge in gold prices since the start of its war in Ukraine, generating gains on a scale comparable to the sovereign reserves frozen in Europe over President Vladimir Putin’s invasion.】

item.title: 波兰考虑禁止中国制造的汽车进入其军事基地
item.description: 据波兰副国防部长透露，该国可能禁止中国制造的汽车进入军事设施，以保护其安全。【原文：Poland may ban Chinese-made cars from entering military facilities in an effort to protect its security, according to a deputy defense minister.】

item.title: 格陵兰与日本地震冲击华尔街平静
item.description: 数周以来，华尔街热议的话题是今年开年市场异常平静。但随着格陵兰岛争端使欧美联盟陷入混乱，加之日本国债暴跌，这份平静正在被打破。【原文：For weeks, the talk on Wall Street was how markets have been unusually subdued at the start of the year. But with a clash over Greenland throwing the European and American alliance in disarray and Japanese bonds plunging, the calm is breaking.】

item.title: 英伟达与SV Angel将以44.8亿美元估值投资Humans&
item.description: 人类公司（Humans&）是一家正在建立前沿人工智能实验室的新创企业，其种子轮融资额达4.8亿美元，估值高达44.8亿美元——对于初创企业而言，这笔融资规模实属罕见。【原文：Humans&, a new startup building a frontier artificial intelligence lab, has raised a $480 million seed funding round at a $4.48 billion valuation — an unusually large haul for a young startup.】

item.title: 阿根廷Pomelo公司完成5500万美元融资，将用于提升支付服务能力
item.description: 阿根廷金融科技初创企业Pomelo在C轮融资中筹集了5500万美元，旨在通过推出与稳定币和实时代理支付相关的新产品，深化其在拉丁美洲的业务布局并拓展全球市场。【原文：Argentina-based financial technology startup Pomelo has raised $55 million in a Series C round as it looks to deepen its presence in Latin America and expand globally with new products tied to stablecoins and real-time agentic payments.】

item.title: 奈飞将华纳兄弟交易的过桥贷款增至420亿美元
item.description: 奈飞公司已从华尔街银行获得更多债务融资，以支持其修订后的全现金收购方案，该方案旨在收购华纳兄弟探索公司的影视制作及流媒体业务。【原文：Netflix Inc. has lined up more debt from Wall Street banks to help finance its amended, all-cash agreement to buy Warner Bros. Discovery Inc.’s studio and streaming business.】

item.title: 沙特债券借款额突破200亿美元，创1月新高
item.description: 自年初以来，沙特阿拉伯已售出逾200亿美元的国际债券，创下1月份的最高纪录，企业与银行正加入政府融资行列。【原文：Saudi Arabia sold more than $20 billion of international bonds since the start of the year, a record for a January as companies and banks join government fund raising.】

item.title: 波兰央行批准购入150吨黄金计划
item.description: 波兰国家银行周二宣布，已批准一项购买最多150吨黄金的计划，此举将使该国黄金储备增至700吨。【原文：The National Bank of Poland approved a plan to buy as much as 150 tons of gold, which would increase the country’s holdings to 700 tons, the central bank said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 美国股指期货下跌，因格陵兰威胁加剧贸易担忧
item.description: 美国股市期货创下11月以来最大跌幅，此前特朗普总统周末就格陵兰岛未来发表的强硬言论，可能引发与欧盟的贸易战。【原文：US stock futures fell the most since November after a weekend of bombast from President Donald Trump over the future of Greenland threatened to spark a trade war with the European Union.】

item.title: 海特曼为房地产搬迁押注筹集26亿美元
item.description: 房地产投资公司海特曼筹集了约26亿美元资金，以把握房地产市场动荡带来的机遇，并由此完成了其有史以来规模最大的封闭式基金募集。【原文：Real estate investment firm Heitman raised about $2.6 billion to take advantage of opportunities arising from the dislocation in property markets, closing its biggest-ever closed-end fund.】

item.title: 中国陷入困境的太阳能行业面临一个闪闪发光的新问题
item.description: 过去一年间，银价已上涨逾三倍，对该国光伏产业造成了严重连锁反应。【原文：The price of silver has more than tripled in the past year, with serious knock-on effects for the country’s photovoltaic industry.】

item.title: Anthropic首席执行官称向中国销售人工智能芯片“如同向朝鲜出售核武器”
item.description: 人类智能公司首席执行官达里奥·阿莫代表示，向中国出售先进人工智能芯片是"具有重大国家安全影响"的错误决策。此前美国政府正推动允许英伟达公司向北京出售其H200处理器。【原文：Anthropic Chief Executive Officer Dario Amodei said selling advanced artificial intelligence chips to China is a blunder with “incredible national security implications” as the US moves to allow Nvidia Corp. to sell its H200 processors to Beijing.】

item.title: 尽管特朗普言辞激烈，美国经济增长仍令达沃斯再次惊艳
item.description: 美国史上最大规模的官方行动旨在给达沃斯与会者留下深刻印象，尽管人们普遍对美国总统的扩张野心感到担忧，但与会者们仍纷纷发表了经济乐观言论。【原文：America’s biggest-ever official effort to impress the Davos crowd was matched with words of economic optimism from attendees, notwithstanding wider alarm at its president’s expansive ambitions.】

item.title: TikTok展现美国人进入"中国式健康习惯时代"
item.description: 网民们纷纷上传记录自己"中国式生活"的视频，并积极践行喝温水等健康习惯。【原文：Internet users are posting videos of their ‘Chinese era’ and embracing practices like drinking warm water.】

item.title: 奈飞在竞购战中提高对华纳兄弟的报价条件，改为全现金收购
item.description: 奈飞公司已达成修订后的全现金收购协议，将收购华纳兄弟探索公司的影视制作及流媒体业务。该公司正与派拉蒙天舞公司展开竞争，争夺这家好莱坞最具标志性的娱乐公司之一。【原文：Netflix Inc. reached an amended, all-cash agreement to buy Warner Bros. Discovery Inc.’s studio and streaming business as it battles Paramount Skydance Corp. to acquire one of Hollywood’s most iconic entertainment companies.】

item.title: 俄罗斯"雨天储备"自乌克兰战争以来首次增长
item.description: 自俄罗斯总统弗拉基米尔·普京发动全面入侵乌克兰以来，该国应急储备金在2025年首次实现增长，政府正采取措施保全其财政缓冲资金的残余部分。【原文：Russia’s rainy-day reserves grew in 2025 for the first time since President Vladimir Putin launched his full-scale invasion of Ukraine as the government moved to conserve what remains of its fiscal buffer.】

item.title: 迪拜环球港务集团调查显示：全球贸易将穿越不确定性
item.description: 尽管面临关税逆风，企业高管仍看好供应链韧性及中国出口稳健表现【原文：Despite tariff headwinds, executives see resilience in supply chains and solid Chinese exports】

item.title: 穆迪称：银行正将医疗债务转给私人贷款机构
item.description: 穆迪评级指出，医疗保健企业正越来越多地向私营信贷公司寻求融资支持，这标志着直接贷款机构在与华尔街同行的竞争中取得胜利。【原文：Health care companies are increasingly tapping private credit firms for their financing needs, marking a win for direct lenders against their Wall Street peers, according to Moody’s Ratings.】

item.title: 英国企业被迫清算数量升至2012年以来最高水平
item.description: 去年英国被迫清算的企业数量攀升至十余年来最高水平，高企的税负与严峻的经济前景令企业举步维艰。【原文：The number of UK firms forced to liquidate rose to the highest level in more than a decade last year, as higher taxes and a challenging economic outlook weighed on businesses.】

item.title: 日本债券市场突发崩盘，引发全球交易大厅动荡
item.description: 日本7.6万亿美元债券市场的抛售最初缓慢展开，随后似乎突然全面爆发。【原文：The selling in Japan’s $7.6 trillion bond market began slowly, then seemed to hit all at once.】

item.title: 日本正推高全球债券收益率
item.description:
日本部分政府债券收益率时隔三十余年首次突破4%。

【原文：

The yield on some Japanese government debt is above 4% for the first time in more than three decades.

】

item.title: 嘉能可案检察官将离开英国打击犯罪机构
item.description: 格伦科尔公司前高管案的主检控官即将离开英国严重欺诈办公室转投私营企业，这使得该反腐机构处理重大腐败案件的努力陷入混乱。【原文：The lead prosecutors of former Glencore Plc executives are set to depart the UK’s Serious Fraud Office for private sector roles, leaving the crime fighting agency’s bid to tackle high-profile corruption cases in disarray.】

item.title: 马哈拉施特拉邦力争在达沃斯论坛上超越去年投资承诺
item.description: 印度工业化程度最高的邦之一的首长在达沃斯表示，该邦预计将超越去年创纪录的投资承诺额，以巩固其作为顶级商业目的地的地位。【原文：The chief minister of one of India’s most industrialized states said in Davos that it expects to surpass last year’s banner showing in investment pledges, as it seeks to reinforce its position as a top destination for business.】

item.title: 野村证券遭阿达尼关联基金起诉，该基金被做空报告指控
item.description: 野村控股公司向某投资基金提供的贷款正面临伦敦诉讼的审查，该基金卷入了一家做空公司对印度亿万富翁高塔姆·阿达尼的指控。【原文：Nomura Holdings Inc.’s loans to an investment fund embroiled in a short-selling firm’s allegations against Indian billionaire Gautam Adani have come under scrutiny in a London lawsuit.】

item.title: 欧洲央行委员维勒鲁瓦认为贸易紧张局势对价格影响有限
item.description: 欧洲央行管理委员会成员弗朗索瓦·维勒鲁瓦·德加洛表示，不断升级的跨大西洋贸易紧张局势对通胀前景影响有限。【原文：Escalating transatlantic trade tensions won’t have much impact on the inflation outlook, according to European Central Bank Governing Council member Francois Villeroy de Galhau.】

item.title: 在与华纳的竞争中，奈飞业绩将揭示基本面状况
item.description: 尽管近日围绕奈飞公司的讨论都聚焦于其对华纳兄弟探索公司开出的天价收购要约，但当这家流媒体巨头在盘后公布财报时，华尔街将有机会将目光投向其他领域——至少在短时间内如此。【原文：While the chatter surrounding Netflix Inc. these days is all about its hefty bid for Warner Bros. Discovery Inc., Wall Street will get an opportunity to focus on something else, at least for a little while, when the streaming giant reports earnings after the bell.】

item.title: 科技投资者称：欧洲必须投资开源人工智能，否则将让位于中国
item.description: 谷歌前首席执行官、科技投资者埃里克·施密特表示，欧洲必须投资建设自己的开源人工智能实验室，并应对能源价格飙升的问题，否则很快就会发现自己依赖于中国模型。【原文：Europe must invest in its own open source artificial intelligence labs and address soaring energy prices, or it will quickly find itself dependent on Chinese models, former Google chief executive and tech investor Eric Schmidt said.】

item.title: 债券发行方谨慎回归，因格陵兰紧张局势加剧
item.description: 周二，部分借款人重返欧洲债务市场，但另一些借款人仍因格陵兰问题与美国关系紧张而保持观望。【原文：Some borrowers ventured back into Europe’s marketplace for debt on Tuesday, though others are still staying away amid tensions with the US over Greenland.】

item.title: 加纳矿商警告：提高黄金特许权使用费可能威胁投资
item.description: 加纳矿业界警告称，政府提议提高对黄金生产商征收的特许权使用费，可能阻碍投资。【原文：Ghana’s mining industry warned that a government proposal to increase the royalty levied on gold producers could deter investment.】

item.title: 贸易动荡冲击新兴市场涨势，收益率攀升
item.description: 新兴市场股市下跌，因日本债券抛售潮及美欧因格陵兰问题爆发贸易战的预期削弱了全球风险偏好。【原文：Emerging-market stocks slipped, as a selloff in Japanese bonds and the prospect of a US-Europe trade war over Greenland sapped global risk appetite.】
